segment.source: Domain controller Refuse machine account password changes (Windows 10)
segment.target: Domain controller Refuse machine account password changes (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain controller Refuse machine account password changes security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain controller Refuse machine account password changes security policy setting.

segment.source: Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes
segment.target: Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting enables or disables blocking a domain controller from accepting password change requests for machine accounts.
segment.target: This policy setting enables or disables blocking a domain controller from accepting password change requests for machine accounts.

segment.source: By default, devices joined to the domain change their machine account passwords every 30 days.
segment.target: By default, devices joined to the domain change their machine account passwords every 30 days.

segment.source: If enabled, the domain controller will refuse machine account password change requests.
segment.target: If enabled, the domain controller will refuse machine account password change requests.

segment.source: When enabled, this setting does not allow a domain controller to accept any changes to a machine account's password.
segment.target: When enabled, this setting does not allow a domain controller to accept any changes to a machine account's password.

segment.source: When disabled, this setting allows a domain controller to accept any changes to a machine account's password.
segment.target: When disabled, this setting allows a domain controller to accept any changes to a machine account's password.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting on all domain controllers in a domain prevents domain members from changing their machine account passwords.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting on all domain controllers in a domain prevents domain members from changing their machine account passwords.

segment.source: This, in turn, leaves those passwords susceptible to attack.
segment.target: This, in turn, leaves those passwords susceptible to attack.

segment.source: Make sure that this conforms to your overall security policy for the domain.
segment.target: Make sure that this conforms to your overall security policy for the domain.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting on all domain controllers in a domain, domain members cannot change their machine account passwords, and those passwords are more susceptible to attack.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting on all domain controllers in a domain, domain members cannot change their machine account passwords, and those passwords are more susceptible to attack.

segment.source: Disable the Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes setting.
segment.target: Disable the Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes setting.
